case_title: ABDUL KARIM vs THE RETURNING OFFICER/AC, HUB AT. HUB and anothers
respondent: The Returning Officer/AC, Hub at Hub and others

legal_basis.constitution_article: Article 199 of the Constitution of Islamic Republic of Pakistan, 1973

key_points.issue: Rejection of nomination papers due to absence of seconder during scrutiny.
key_points.decision: Absence of seconder is not mandatory under Rule 17 of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983.
key_points.directive: Returning Officer to include Abdul Karim's name in the list of validly nominated candidates.

legal_arguments.petitioner: Presence of seconder not mandatory under Rule 17; rejection caused miscarriage of justice.
legal_arguments.respondent: Presence of seconder necessary to verify authenticity of signatures.

judgment_summary: The court ruled that the absence of seconder during scrutiny does not justify rejection of nomination papers as per Rule 17 of the Balochistan Local Government (Election) Rules, 1983. Abdul Karim was declared a validly nominated candidate.
